meanings.definition: To give or ascribe value or validity to something.
meanings.sent1: She valorised the old family heirloom by displaying it prominently in the living room.
meanings.sent2: The new paint job valorised the entire house, making it look brand new.
meanings.sent3: The cat valorised the empty box as her new favorite hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: His kind words valorised her self-esteem, lifting her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The certificate valorised his hard work and dedication to the company.

meanings.definition: To enhance the value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: Adding a garden to the backyard valorised the property, making it more attractive to buyers.
meanings.sent2: The unique design features valorised the luxury car, setting it apart from the competition.
meanings.sent3: The chef valorised the simple dish by adding a touch of exotic spices.
meanings.sent4: Her smile valorised the photograph, capturing a moment of pure joy.
meanings.sent5: The rare painting valorised the art collection, adding a touch of sophistication.

meanings.definition: To treat or regard something as valuable or important.
meanings.sent1: She valorised her friendship with him, always making time for their conversations.
meanings.sent2: The teacher valorised education above all else, inspiring her students to excel.
meanings.sent3: The child valorised his favorite toy, carrying it with him everywhere he went.
meanings.sent4: The community valorised the local park, coming together to keep it clean and safe.
meanings.sent5: He valorised honesty in all his dealings, earning the trust of those around him.
